titleInfo.title: Children at the National Home for Jewish Children in Denver

physicalDescription.extent: 2 item (photograph), 5 x 7 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#388 Residents of Nat. Home for Jewish Children'' and ''Jewish Sheltering Home 1910-1950s''. On back of photograph: ''#388 National Home for Jewish Children at Denver Smiling Pals -- The Beginning of Life-Long Friendships, late 1930s R-L Joey Carsh, Barbara Blackmer, Joey Barret, Ester Cash, Alvin Vihon''.

mods.abstract: From right to left: Joey Carsh, Barbara Blackmer, Joey Barret, Ester Cash, and Alvin Uikon sitting in a garden at the National Home for Jewish Children at Denver in Denver, Colorado. The Home later became part of the National Jewish Hospital.
mods.note: Donated by the National Asthma Center.

name.namePart: National Home for Jewish Children in Denver

titleInfo.title: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Health Care and Philanthropy
